oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Wind thought to be seen, in the form of a bird, by the brother-in-law of the narrator when a child. By /han=kasso (L VIII.-8. 6713-6724). ||goo-ka-!kui (Smoke's man, or Witbooi Tooren) told |han=kass'o that he had seen the Wind at the mountains at Haarfontein (or =ko a xa) and had thrown a stone at it, thinking it to be a bird. As a result the Wind blew hard and took up dust.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Wind Notes to the story of
